title: Duplicate key violation issue while updating
body:
Hi!

The update exists with an error of duplicate key violation. Here is the output:

```bash
Currently at sequence 3895874 (17/02/2020 21:59:59) - 1 indexed
/srv/nominatim/.local/bin/pyosmium-get-changes --server https://planet.openstreetmap.org/replication/minute -o /srv/nominatim/build/osmosischange.osc -s 1 -I 3895874
/srv/nominatim/build/osm2pgsql/osm2pgsql -klas --number-processes 1 -C 2000 -O gazetteer -S /srv/nominatim/Nominatim/settings/import-full.style -d nominatim -P 5432 --flat-nodes /srv/nominatim/flatnode.file /srv/nominatim/build/osmosischange.osc
osm2pgsql version 1.2.0 (64 bit id space)

Allocating memory for dense node cache
Allocating dense node cache in one big chunk
Allocating memory for sparse node cache
Sharing dense sparse
Node-cache: cache=2000MB, maxblocks=32000*65536, allocation method=11
Mid: loading persistent node cache from /srv/nominatim/flatnode.file
Mid: pgsql, cache=2000
Parsing gazetteer style file '/srv/nominatim/Nominatim/settings/import-full.style'.
Using projection SRS 4326 (Latlong)

Reading in file: /srv/nominatim/build/osmosischange.osc
Using XML parser.
  parse time: 0s
Node stats: total(8258), max(7221303196) in 0s
Way stats: total(1050), max(773641250) in 0s
Relation stats: total(33), max(10722043) in 0s
result COPY END for place failed: ERROR:  duplicate key value violates unique constraint "idx_place_osm_unique"
DETAIL:  Key (osm_id, osm_type, class)=(6607924, R, boundary) already exists.
CONTEXT:  COPY place, line 482: "6607924        R       boundary        region  "name"=>"Región Nororiental"    15      \N      "wikidata"=>"Q2883878","wikipedia"=>"e..."

DB copy thread failed: Ending COPY mode
Error executing osm2pgsql: 2
```

```sql
nominatim=# \d place
                          Table "public.place"
   Column    |          Type           | Collation | Nullable | Default
-------------+-------------------------+-----------+----------+---------
 osm_id      | bigint                  |           | not null |
 osm_type    | character(1)            |           | not null |
 class       | text                    |           | not null |
 type        | text                    |           | not null |
 name        | hstore                  |           |          |
 admin_level | smallint                |           |          |
 address     | hstore                  |           |          |
 extratags   | hstore                  |           |          |
 geometry    | geometry(Geometry,4326) |           | not null |
Indexes:
    "idx_place_osm_unique" UNIQUE, btree (osm_id, osm_type, class)
    "place_id_idx" btree (osm_type, osm_id)
Triggers:
    place_before_delete BEFORE DELETE ON place FOR EACH ROW EXECUTE PROCEDURE place_delete()
    place_before_insert BEFORE INSERT ON place FOR EACH ROW EXECUTE PROCEDURE place_insert()
```

```sql
Triggers:
    placex_before_delete AFTER DELETE ON placex FOR EACH ROW EXECUTE PROCEDURE placex_delete()
    placex_before_insert BEFORE INSERT ON placex FOR EACH ROW EXECUTE PROCEDURE placex_insert()
    placex_before_update BEFORE UPDATE ON placex FOR EACH ROW EXECUTE PROCEDURE placex_update()
```

A row exists for the said Relation in `place` table. 
Also the osmosis change file:
```bash
nominatim@ubuntu:~/build$ grep 6607924 osmosischange.osc
    <relation id="6607924" version="25" timestamp="2020-02-17T22:04:22Z" uid="5443883" user="Wilmer Osario" changeset="81138290">
```

I am running Nominatim on the latest master branch.

This is similar to #468

title: Display address is inconsistent when crossing boundaries
body:
I found two points in Germany, where nomination delivers a wrong state attribute.
First one is:
https://nominatim.openstreetmap.org/reverse?format=json&lat=53.02828&lon=8.933256&accept-language=en&addressdetails=1

Which returns:
{"place_id":179125997,"licence":"Data © OpenStreetMap contributors, ODbL 1.0. https://osm.org/copyright","osm_type":"way","osm_id":478793738,"lat":"53.0283197060677","lon":"8.9332646642824","display_name":"A 1, Mahndorf, Hemelingen, Stadtbezirk Bremen-Ost, Achim, Bremen, Lower Saxony, 28307, Germany","address":{"road":"A 1","neighbourhood":"Mahndorf","suburb":"Hemelingen","city_district":"Stadtbezirk Bremen-Ost","town":"Achim","city":"Bremen","state":"**Lower Saxony**","postcode":"28307","country":"Germany","country_code":"de"},"boundingbox":["53.0272783","53.0292419","8.9302322","8.9568636"]}

=> state should be the same as the city "Bremen".

---
The second one is:
https://nominatim.openstreetmap.org/reverse?format=json&lat=49.633598&lon=9.273487&accept-language=en&addressdetails=1

Which returns:
{"place_id":89635259,"licence":"Data © OpenStreetMap contributors, ODbL 1.0. https://osm.org/copyright","osm_type":"way","osm_id":53840747,"lat":"49.6340219521602","lon":"9.27383738299715","display_name":"B 47, Schneeberg, Verwaltungsverband Hardheim-Walldürn, Landkreis Miltenberg, Lower Franconia, Baden-Württemberg, 63936, Germany","address":{"road":"B 47","suburb":"Schneeberg","village":"Schneeberg","county":"Verwaltungsverband Hardheim-Walldürn","state_district":"Lower Franconia","state":"**Baden-Württemberg**","postcode":"63936","country":"Germany","country_code":"de"},"boundingbox":["49.6254243","49.6408555","9.2615423","9.2889123"]}

=> "Schneeberg (Unterfranken)" belongs to state "Bayern", although the point is located in state "Baden-Württemberg".

kobi

title: POIs do not inherit addr:street from their building correctly
body:
If I do a search for "Rontgenova 1" the first result returned is a fast_food amenity way off the actual location even though an exact address exists in OSM db: https://nominatim.openstreetmap.org/search.php?q=rontgenova+1&polygon_geojson=1&viewbox=

It looks like from a nearby location only housenumber information (1) is taken.

title: Street address taken from neighbouring street, not address tag
body:
In the [German Forum](https://forum.openstreetmap.org/viewtopic.php?pid=702642#p702642) someone raised an issue not being able to find a certain building in Italy with Nominatim. The building in question is tagged with 

building = yes
addr:city = Trichiana
addr:postcode=32028
addr:street=Via Cavassico superiore
addr:housenumber=19

Yet [in Nominatim the street address of the building is Via Frazione Cavassico](https://nominatim.openstreetmap.org/details.php?place_id=237509774). Nominatim should take the street address information from the tag instead. Searching for something like "Via Cavassico superiore 19, 32028 Trichiana" only returns the street but not the building.

title: Searching for Orange County, Vermont gives result in California.
body:
https://nominatim.openstreetmap.org/search.php?q=Orange+County%2C+Vermont

Searching for Orange County, Vermont returns one result: Vermont, Walnut, Irvine, Orange County, California.

Adding the country returns the correct result (Orange County, Vermont, USA).

title: No result instead of approximate result for a known address
body:
Hi.

I was testing out the nominatim service and put in a house I know of in Burbank CA:

430 E. Fairmount Rd., Burbank, CA, 91501

I got no result back.

I put in 482 E. Fairmount Rd., Burbank, CA 91501 and got a "valid result", even though there is no such address, and even though that result points at the house that is actually numbered 430.

<http://nominatim.openstreetmap.org/search.php?q=482+E.+Fairmount+Rd.%2C+Burbank%2C+CA+91501&polygon_geojson=1&viewbox=>

Last week, hoping to fix these results, I inserted the house number at the end of the block, 432 on the right side, and 437 on the left.  I was hoping to convince the nominatim engine to interpolate the house addresses from 400 to 432.  No joy.  A query for 432 works properly:

<http://nominatim.openstreetmap.org/search.php?q=432+E.+Fairmount+Rd.%2C+Burbank%2C+CA+91501&polygon_geojson=1&viewbox=>

but a query for 430 fails

<http://nominatim.openstreetmap.org/search.php?q=430+E.+Fairmount+Rd.%2C+Burbank%2C+CA+91501&polygon_geojson=1&viewbox=>

What I would expect would be an approximate match.  Even though the numbering interpolation is incorrect for this part of the city of Burbank, I would expect nominatim would at least pick an approximate place maybe 1/3 of the way up the block, instead of no result.  Second, I would expect that given that nominatim knows how to find the house number 432, it should deduce that the remaining houses on the block run from 400 to 432 and interpolate accordingly.

I hope this report is helpful.

title: No results when adding postal code to search query
body:
[No result](http://nominatim.openstreetmap.org/search.php?q=Jacob+Stolpstraat+4%2C+1462MV+Middenbeemster%2C+NL&addressdetails=1&format=json) vs [result](http://nominatim.openstreetmap.org/search.php?q=Jacob+Stolpstraat+4%2C+Middenbeemster%2C+NL&addressdetails=1&format=json)

The weird thing is that when you open 'result' you see the postcode matches the one given in the query string in the 'No result' link. The given street is currently in building process. For all other requests it's working perfectly.

[Result](http://nominatim.openstreetmap.org/search.php?q=Kalverstraat+3%2C+1012NX+Amsterdam%2C+NL&addressdetails=1&format=json) vs [result](http://nominatim.openstreetmap.org/search.php?q=Kalverstraat+3%2C+Amsterdam%2C+NL&addressdetails=1&format=json)

I hope somebody can help me out :)

title: interpolations and tiger results return wrong osm_id
body:
Searched on OSM first, http://www.openstreetmap.org/search?query=22+Murray+Park - locates the address correctly, but it links to the wrong way: http://www.openstreetmap.org/way/26041327

Tried Nominatim, http://nominatim.openstreetmap.org/search.php?q=22+Murray+Park but again it tries to link to the same way: http://nominatim.openstreetmap.org/details.php?place_id=26041327

If I add the town (St Andrews) or use a different street/place (try 3 Nethergate, Crail) the same thing happens.

However if I use 20 Murray Park, it locates and correctly links to the address node (of course!).

title: Deadlock Rank 16
body:
Hello,
I'm running the Europe import with an underpowered hardware ( 8Mb RAM), anyway after settings adjustment as suggested by Sarah I did some progress. 
Now I get a deadlock error in the indexing phase at rank 16. 
After I have relaunched the script with ./utils/setup.php --index --create-search-indices I got anothe deadlock error. I have relaunched again and now it's working on rank 17.
Here the log of the first deadlock ( no memory errors in journalctl )

```
Done 7402 in 491 @ 15.075356 per second - Rank 16 ETA (seconds): 7744.493652
  Done 7404 in 492 @ 15.048780 per second - Rank 16 ETA (seconds): 7758.037109
index_placex: UPDATE failed: ERRORE:  rilevato deadlock
DETAIL:  Il processo 15310 è in attesa di ShareLock su la transazione 3482747; bloccato dal processo 15309
Il processo 15309 è in attesa di ShareLock su la transazione 3482746; bloccato dal processo 15310
HINT:  Vedi i log del server per i dettagli della query.
CONTEXT:  istruzione SQL "UPDATE placex SET linked_place_id = NEW.place_id WHERE place_id = linked_node_id"
PL/pgSQL function placex_update() line 137 at istruzione SQL
ERROR: Error executing external command: /srv/nominatim/Nominatim/nominatim/nominatim -i -d nominatim -P 5432 -t 3 -r 5 -R 25
Error executing external command: /srv/nominatim/Nominatim/nominatim/nominatim -i -d nominatim -P 5432 -t 3 -r 5 -R 25

```

Thanks in advance.

title: template/address-html.php cannot handle null answer
body:
Example: http://nominatim.openstreetmap.org/reverse.php?format=html&lat=48.00168540347722&lon=-34.27734375

Results in a lot of warnings about undefined index in template/address-html.php

title: SQL error on reverse geocoding of interpolated address
body:
Occasionally reverse geocoding fails with the following message in the postgres error logs:

```
ERROR:  line_interpolate_point: 2nd arg isn't within [0,1]
STATEMENT:  select place_id, partition, 'W' as osm_type, osm_id, 'place' as class, 'house' as type, null admin_level, housenumber, null as street, null as isin, postcode, calculated_country_code as country_code, parent_place_id, null as linked_place_id, 30 as rank_address, 30 as rank_search, (0.75-(30::float/40)) as importance, null as indexed_status, null as indexed_date, null as wikipedia, calculated_country_code,  get_address_by_language(place_id, housenumber, ARRAY['short_name','name','brand','official_name','ref','type']) as langaddress, null as placename, null as ref, ST_X(point) as lon, ST_Y(point) as lat from (select *, ST_LineInterpolatePoint(linegeo, (housenumber-startnumber::float)/(endnumber-startnumber)::float) as point from  (select *,  CASE WHEN interpolationtype='odd' THEN floor((1*(endnumber-startnumber)+startnumber)/2)::int*2+1 WHEN interpolationtype='even' THEN ((1*(endnumber-startnumber)+startnumber)/2)::int*2 WHEN interpolationtype='all' THEN (1*(endnumber-startnumber)+startnumber)::int END as housenumber from location_property_osmline where place_id = 11679134) as blub1) as blub2
```

The problematic interpolation line is starting at this node: https://www.openstreetmap.org/node/1202725003 Note that the interpolation is odd but has an even endpoint. The error happens when the computed fraction is 1.

Need to write test case.

title: Is this normal that we use rank_search in placex_update an rank_address in get_addressdata
body:
Hi,

Some placex doesn't have anything when we call get_addressdata. Like this one

http://nominatim.openstreetmap.org/details.php?place_id=144938208

I think this is due to the following : in placex_update the IF " For low level elements we inherit from our parent road" is based on "NEW.rank_search > 27", if we enter this if, we don't fill the place_addressline table but just the parent_place_id. Which is fine because our place is not big and it'll get its adress from its parent.
In get_addressdata the condition for using the parent place_id is "and rank_address = 30 ", so in my exemple the place has a rank_search at 30 but a rank_address at 0 so the get_addressdata methode won't return anything.

Is this normal ? If not I'll send a pull request

title: place_parent_id wrong
body:
Hi,

I have this place :
http://nominatim.openstreetmap.org/details.php?place_id=17296552

This place is located in Maritime Alps, not in "Alpes-de-Haute-Provence". The problem is due to its parent_place_id being equal to 
http://nominatim.openstreetmap.org/details.php?place_id=142870848
instead of 
http://nominatim.openstreetmap.org/details.php?place_id=144580543

I don't know why the parent id is wrong because the geometry seems correct

title: Linked places should not appear in place_addressline
body:
I did some reverse geocoding task using points located in Japan. The result seems not right.
For example [http://nominatim.openstreetmap.org/reverse?format=xml&lat=32.687&lon=129.847&zoom=18&addressdetails=1](url)  shows this point in  Nishi Sonogi County. This is not right.  Nishi Sonogi County should be the same level as Nagasaki city and it does not cover Nagasaki.

title: Vatican City country code
body:
Hi, I'm facing a small issue working with Nominatim due the fact that Vatican City country code is missing.

As can be verified in [https://nominatim.openstreetmap.org/details.php?place_id=143992614](https://nominatim.openstreetmap.org/details.php?place_id=143992614), its address field has no place:country_code associated.

For sake of comparison, here are the details for another country (Albania) [https://nominatim.openstreetmap.org/details.php?place_id=144919794](https://nominatim.openstreetmap.org/details.php?place_id=144919794) . It can be noticed that the second line of the address field contains the country's respective code ('al').

(additionally - and probably also related to this issue - I have noticed that the Vatican City field "Rank" is equal "Sea", while the same field is equal to "Country" for the other countries).

title: place node is loaded but isn't in search result?
body:
The following place is loaded in nominatim: 
http://nominatim.openstreetmap.org/details?osmtype=N&osmid=289812744

But if you search for "Steckenborn" the place-Node isn't in the result list, why?

title: Case-sensivity in query with starting lower case letter "г"
body: This bug https://trac.openstreetmap.org/ticket/2758#comment:6 is still reprodused.

title: Case-sensitivity in query: "LA" vs "la"
body:
Two searches differing only by case yield different results.:
1.
`curl --header "Accept-Language: en-US" 'http://nominatim.openstreetmap.org/search.p?format=json&q=la'
`
2.
`curl --header "Accept-Language: en-US" 'http://nominatim.openstreetmap.org/search.p?format=json&q=LA'
`
The former results in several matches for Louisiana, while the latter yields no results.

"LA" seems to be the only case I've found so far. Btw, both Google Maps and Photon find "Los Angeles" rather than "Louisiana" for the "la" query.

title: Strange sections in details view
body: See http://nominatim.openstreetmap.org/details.php?place_id=142321454. There are sections 'D' and 'S' which lead to nowhere.

title: --osmosis-init download wrong state.txt
body:
At January 31-st I loaded test country Andorra (from http://download.geofabrik.de/europe/andorra-latest.osm.pbf). A few steps then in the script it is command 'setup.php --osmosis-init' and I see it downloaded wrong state.txt file (http://download.geofabrik.de/europe/andorra-updates/000/000/999.state.txt). Correct url is .../000/001/053.state.txt (probably). 
I analyzed that the issue and I found that geofabrik touch the directory 000 and change it the modified date. Then sorting directories are wrong. I changed the line 599 and 614 in the setup.php to "?C=N;O=A;F=1" and now init osmosis downloaded correct file .../000/001/048.state.txt (I think so).

title: Different language specific abbreviations of the same word will not work
body:
Pro memoria.

Case at hand: street name including  "Santa"  ES, PT -> Sta. , IT -> S. (Nominatim handles the former).

Workaround use short_name on the street for the abbreviated name.

title: Search for address in Karlsruhe city shows 10 results from Karlsruhe administrative region before results from the city for some addresses
body:
This is the original map issue, I was sent here as they said it's not an error in the mapping:
http://www.openstreetmap.org/note/460676#map=18/49.01134/8.39550&layers=N

A search for „Karlstraße 1, Karlsruhe“ (or any other way around) shows 10 results from Karlsruhe administrative region. The 11th result you see after clicking „More results“ is the entry actually searched for in Karlsruhe city.

This problem occurs for several other street numbers, too, but e.g. not for „Karlstraße 3, Karlsruhe“ - very strange. There seems to be no difference in the data of the two buildings.

title: Country search should respect bounded=1
body:
Look at this query:

https://nominatim.openstreetmap.org/search?q=1&viewbox=121.46120881275779%2C31.191112999955877%2C121.5710631872422%2C31.257170983698707&bounded=1&format=json

Viewbox: [121.46120881275779, 31.191112999955877, 121.5710631872422, 31.257170983698707]

As both viewbox and bounded=1 are specified, if there is no match result in given viewbox, i would expect that an empty array is returned (as implicated with "bounded=1"). But actually irrelevant out-of-bounds results are returned instead (viewbox and bounded=1 are all ignored), e.g., 

``` json
[
    {
        "place_id":"127735029",
        "osm_id":"304716",
        "boundingbox":["6.5546079", "35.6745457", "68.1113787", "97.395561"],
        "lat":"22.3511148",
        "lon":"78.6677428",
        "display_name":"India",
    }
]
```

In case there is any match, it seemed that "bounded=1" is obeyed well, e.g.,

https://nominatim.openstreetmap.org/search?q=浦电路&viewbox=121.46120881275779%2C31.191112999955877%2C121.5710631872422%2C31.257170983698707&bounded=1&format=json

The behavior is inconsistent.

title: "Search for more results" link broken in new install
body:
Was testing a new 2.3 install and noticed the link under the search results for "Search for more results" send the user to a non-existent page.

The trouble appears to be in website/search.php on line 120:

``` php
$sMoreURL = CONST_Website_BaseURL.'search?format='.urlencode($sOutputFormat).'&exclude_place_ids='.join(',',$oGeocode->getExcludedPlaceIDs());
```

Shouldn't we be sending the user to 'search.php' not 'search'?

title: differences in importance between village and town
body:
While debugging some [photon](github.com/komoot/photon) results I came across these two nominatim entries:

[Bailleul](http://nominatim.openstreetmap.org/details.php?place_id=127679278), importance: 0.39 place=town
[Bailleul-Sir-Berthould](http://nominatim.openstreetmap.org/details.php?place_id=127809443) importance: 0.59 place=village

Both of them have an calculated wikipedia assignment, so I do not understand why a village has an significant higher importance than town. Could it be a bug?

title: Strange error, on details.php
body:
i get this error, in the secound that i have created a new nominatim server,
http://nominatim.2.acronshop.ro/details.php?place_id=31643326
Notice: Undefined index: place:neighbourhood in /opt/Nominatim/website/details.php on line 79

i have found that inside the getClassTypes() from lib.php is missing the place:neighbourhood key from the array. What is the value for this element?

title: gb postcodes data and searching failures
body:
[I posted this as a question on OpenStreetMap Help and was advised to submit it as a new issue]

I'm trying to use Nominatim to get the Lat/Long for GB Postcodes and struggling. To avoid pounding on OpenStreetMaps's servers I've setup my own Nominatim with the gb_postcode_data but it doesn't seem to get used.

If I query like so:

wget -O - -q "http://mynominatim.somewhere/search?format=xml&postalcode=KA2 9AE&country=gb"

I get no result (same result if I use nominatim.openstreetmap.org for the above query).

wget -O - -q "http://mynominatim.somewhere/search?format=xml&postcode=KA2 9AE&country=gb"

I get no result (using nominatim.openstreetmap.org I get the centroid for the GB admin boundary polygon returned).

wget -O - -q "http://mynominatim.somewhere/search?format=xml&q=KA2 9AE&country=gb"

Returns a place in Wales but the KA2 9AE postcode is in Dundonald, Scotland (the same query on nominatim.openstreetmap.org returns no result). However using "PE8 6XH" as the postcode in the above query I get sensible results from both the official and my nominatim. Huh?

I've checked and "KA2 9AE" is in the gb_postcode_data.sql.gz file so why's it not being used? 

Why the different results from 'my' nominatim and the official one?

I'm probably doing something stupid but I can't work out what. Enlightenment would be greatly appreciated.

title: Some special phrases clash with normalisation abbreviation
body: Example: try searching for 'river in london' which returns strange results because the term is abbreviated to 'r 1 london'.

title: lat and lon for zipcode 45401 is not correct
body:
When I use nominatim to search for the zip code 45401, it returns Brunswick, but it should be Dayton, OH. It seems this zipcode returns incorrect latitude and longitude.
The lat and lon for 45401 should be (39.750471,-84.268593), not 31.1319976, -81.4859267)

The url is http://nominatim.openstreetmap.org/search?q=45401&format=json&polygon=0&addressdetails=1&limit=3&countrycodes=us,ca.

title: Update of linked places should trigger an update of the linkee
body: Needed so that changes in names are merged in correctly.

title: Geocoding fails when searching for both name and house number
body:
As reported via [help.openstreetmap.org](https://help.openstreetmap.org/questions/35073/ensuring-buildings-can-be-found-by-nominatim) the search yields no result when searching for both the name and the house number. Example:
- [Searching for the name](https://www.openstreetmap.org/search?query=Tower%20B%2C%20Legget%20Dr%2C%20Ottawa) succeeds
- [Searching for the house number](https://www.openstreetmap.org/search?query=555%20Legget%20Dr%2C%20Ottawa) succeeds
- [Searching for both the name and the house number](https://www.openstreetmap.org/search?query=Tower%20B%2C%20555%20Legget%20Dr%2C%20Ottawa) fails

title: boundary ways are not deleted when becoming a way
body: When a way changes from polygon geometry to simple way geometry it is not deleted from the placex table. Example: http://www.openstreetmap.org/way/246314911

title: state missing in reverse geocoding
body:
I was told it's a good idea to report it, see last few comments in:

https://help.openstreetmap.org/questions/31439/state-is-missing-in-reverse-geocoding
